data.enText: to move your hand, or sth such as a cloth, backwards and forwards over a surface while pressing firmly

data.chText: 她若有所思地抚摩着下巴。
data.enText: She rubbed her chin thoughtfully.

data.chText: 用砂纸打磨表面，然后再上油漆。
data.enText: Rub the surface with sandpaper before painting.
The cat rubbed itself against my legs.
I rubbed at the stain on the cloth.

data.chText: 动物一直在这些树上蹭来蹭去。
data.enText: Animals had been rubbing against the trees.
Rub the surface smooth.
to press two surfaces against each other and move them backwards and forwards; to be pressed together and move in this way
She rubbed her hands in delight.

data.chText: 听起来就像是两块木头在一起摩擦。
data.enText: It sounded like two pieces of wood rubbing together.

data.chText: 磨，摩擦（尤指引起疼痛或损害）
data.enText: to move backwards and forwards many times against sth while pressing it, especially causing pain or damage
The back of my shoe is rubbing.
The wheel is rubbing on the mudguard.

data.chText: 马脖子上套过缰绳的地方皮都给磨掉了。
data.enText: The horse's neck was rubbed raw (= until the skin came off) where the rope had been.
to spread a liquid or other substance over a surface while pressing firmly

data.chText: 她把润肤液揉搓进皮肤里。
data.enText: She rubbed the lotion into her skin.
rub sb's nose in it

data.chText: 揭疮疤；不断恶意提起某人以往的过失
data.enText: to keep reminding sb in an unkind way of their past mistakes
rub salt into the wound
rub salt into sb's wounds

data.chText: 在伤口上抹盐；使雪上加霜
data.enText: to make a difficult experience even more difficult for sb
rub shoulders with sb
rub elbows with sb
to meet and spend time with a famous person, socially or as part of your job
rub sb up the wrong way
rub sb the wrong way
to make sb annoyed or angry, often without intending to, by doing or saying sth that offends them
not have two beans, brain cells, etc. to rub together

data.chText: 不名一文（或没有脑子等）
data.enText: to have no money; to be very stupid, etc.
rub along (with sb/together)
to live or work together in a friendly enough way
rub sb/oneself/sth↔down
to rub the skin of a person, horse, etc. hard with sth to make it clean and dry
rub sth↔down

data.chText: （用特别材料）将某物打磨光滑
data.enText: to make sth smooth by rubbing it with a special material
rub it in
rub sth in

data.chText: 反复提及令人尴尬的事；触及痛处
data.enText: to keep reminding sb of sth they feel embarrassed about and want to forget

data.chText: 我知道我当时很愚蠢；你不必老提这件事。
data.enText: I know I was stupid; you don't have to rub it in .
rub off (on/onto sb)

before.enText: of personal qualities, behaviour, opinions, etc.

data.enText: to become part of a person's character as a result of that person spending time with sb who has those qualities, etc.

data.chText: 她的幽默感已经传给了她的孩子。
data.enText: Her sense of fun has rubbed off on her children.
rub sth↔off (sth)
rub off
to remove sth or to be removed by rubbing
She rubbed off the dead skin.

data.chText: 金黄色已经开始剥落了。
data.enText: The gold colouring had begun to rub off.

data.chText: 如果你在黑板上写字，下课时要擦掉。
data.enText: If you write on the blackboard, rub it off at the end of the lesson.
rub sb↔out
to murder sb
rub sth↔out
erase
to remove the marks made by a pencil, etc., using a rubber/eraser
to rub out a mistake
an act of rubbing a surface
She gave her knee a quick rub.
or
a problem or difficulty

data.chText: 难就难在旅馆很偏远，我们又没有汽车。
data.enText: The hotel is in the middle of nowhere and there lies the rub . We don't have a car.

means: 摩擦(尤指引起疼痛或损害)

trans: 不断提及（某人不愿记住的事）

tr: the act of rubbing or wiping
example: he gave the hood a quick rub

tr: scrape or rub as if to relieve itching

value.def: If you rub a part of your body, you move your hand or fingers backwards and forwards over it while pressing firmly.

example.ex: He rubbed his arms and stiff legs...
example.tran: 他按摩着自己的胳膊和僵硬的双腿。

example.ex: 'I fell in a ditch', he said, rubbing at a scrape on his hand.
example.tran: “我掉进沟里了”，他一边说着，一边揉着手上的擦伤。

value.def: If you rub against a surface or rub a part of your body against a surface, you move it backwards and forwards while pressing it against the surface.

example.ex: A cat was rubbing against my leg...
example.tran: 一只猫在我腿上蹭来蹭去。

example.ex: He kept rubbing his leg against mine.
example.tran: 他不停地用腿蹭我的腿。

value.def: If you rub an object or a surface, you move a cloth backward and forward over it in order to clean or dry it.

example.ex: She took off her glasses and rubbed them hard...
He rubbed and rubbed but couldn't seem to get clean.
example.tran: 他擦了又擦，可就是擦不干净。

value.def: If you rub a substance into a surface or rub something such as dirt from a surface, you spread it over the surface or remove it from the surface using your hand or something such as a cloth.

example.ex: He rubbed oil into my back...
I pretended to rub a fleck of grit from one eye.
example.tran: 我假装拭去一只眼睛里的沙粒。

value.def: If you rub two things together or if they rub together, they move backwards and forwards, pressing against each other.

example.ex: He rubbed his hands together a few times.
...the 650-mile rift that separates the Pacific and North American geological plates as they rub together.
example.tran: 太平洋和北美洲地质板块相互摩擦时产生的一条长达650英里的裂缝

value.def: If something you are wearing or holding rubs, it makes you sore because it keeps moving backwards and forwards against your skin.

example.ex: Smear cream on to your baby's skin at the edges of the plaster to prevent it from rubbing.
example.tran: 在宝宝贴膏药的皮肤边缘涂上护肤霜，以防止膏药擦伤皮肤。

value.def: Rub is used in expressions such as there's the rub and the rub is when you are mentioning a difficulty that makes something hard or impossible to achieve.

example.ex: 'What do you want to write about?'. And there was the rub, because I didn't yet know.
example.tran: “你想写什么？”难就难在这儿，因为我还不知道写什么。

value.def: A massage can be referred to as a rub .

example.ex: She sometimes asks if I want a back rub.
example.tran: 她有时会问我想不想做个背部按摩。

value.def: A rub is a substance that you massage into your skin.

example.ex: ...a fresh cucumber rub for your whole face.
example.tran: 用新鲜黄瓜给整张脸做的面膜

value.def: If you rub shoulders with famous people, you meet them and talk to them. You can also say that you rub elbows with someone, especially in American English.

example.ex: He regularly rubbed shoulders with the likes of Elizabeth Taylor and Kylie Minogue.
example.tran: 他经常与伊丽莎白·泰勒和凯莉·米洛这样的人接触。

value.tran: （尤用于美国英语）和（名人）接触，和（名人）交往

value.def: If you rub someone up the wrong way in British English, or rub someone the wrong way in American English, you offend or annoy them without intending to.

example.ex: What are you going to get out of him if you rub him up the wrong way?
example.tran: 你要是不小心把他惹毛了，你有什么好处？

value.tran: 无意中冒犯;无意中惹恼

xrse.def: to rub salt into the wound
